meanings.definition: A small, typically nocturnal lizard with adhesive pads on the feet, found in warm climates.
meanings.sent1: The geckoes scurried up the wall with ease using their sticky feet.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of geckoes climbing the tree in the garden last night.
meanings.sent3: The geckoes had a race to see who could reach the top of the wall first.
meanings.sent4: Her agility on the dance floor was compared to that of a gecko's movements.
meanings.sent5: The geckoes' ability to cling to surfaces amazed the onlookers.

meanings.definition: A person who is easily deceived or made fun of.
meanings.sent1: He felt like a geckoes when his friends played a prank on him.
meanings.sent2: The class clown often targeted the new student, calling him a geckoes.
meanings.sent3: Being the geckoes of the group, she fell for their practical jokes every time.
meanings.sent4: She realized she had been a geckoes in their scheme to surprise her.
meanings.sent5: The geckoes of the office, he was always the one to believe in office rumors.
